sequoia.Company purpose: Start here: define your company in a single declarative sentence. This is harder than it looks. It's easy to get caught up listing features instead of communicating your mission.
sequoia.Problem: Describe the pain of your customer. How is this addressed today and what are the shortcomings to current solutions.
sequoia.Solution: Explain your eureka moment. Why is your value prop unique and compelling? Why will it endure? And where does it go from here?
sequoia.Why now?: The best companies almost always have a clear why now? Nature hates a vacuumâ€”so why hasn't your solution been built before now?
sequoia.Market potential: Identify your customer and your market. Some of the best companies invent their own markets.
sequoia.Competition / alternatives: Who are your direct and indirect competitors. Show that you have a plan to win.
sequoia.Business model: How do you intend to thrive?
sequoia.Team: Tell the story of your founders and key team members.
sequoia.Financials: If you have any, please include.
sequoia.Vision: If all goes well, what will you have built in five years?
